description: From Middle English requiten (“to repay”), from Old French requiter.

verbs.description: requite (third-person singular simple present requites, present participle requiting, simple past and past participle requited)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To return (usually something figurative) that has been given; to repay; to recompense
examples: Good cryptographists are rare indeed; and thus their services, although seldom required, are necessarily well requited.
